alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 8:59PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northeastern Kit Carson County in east central Colorado, southwestern Cheyenne and northwestern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 845 PM MDT/945 PM CDT/... At 754 PM MDT/854 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles northeast of Cope, or 22 miles northwest of Bonny Reservoir, moving southeast at 40 mph. Other showers and storms across Yuma County moving into Northwest Kansas and Kit Carson County may be capable of downburst winds up to 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bonny Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas near mile marker 6. Highway 385 between mile markers 201 and 227. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
